docs.lead_paragraph: N.F.L. Hall of Fame member Joe DeLamielleure has been an outspoken advocate for improving benefits and care for his fellow retired players, unleashing his take-no-prisoners style on everyone from the late union leader Gene Upshaw to his current target: Saints quarterback Drew Brees, who is taking an increasingly high-profile role in union matters.

headline.main: DeLamielleure Slams Brees' Stance on Retired Players' Benefits

docs.abstract: N.F.L. Hall of Famer Joe DeLamielleure harshly criticized New Orleans quarterback Drew Brees for his stance on retired players' benefits.
docs.snippet: N.F.L. Hall of Famer Joe DeLamielleure harshly criticized New Orleans quarterback Drew Brees for his stance on retired players' benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Times's Marcus Mabry and David M. Herszenhorn discuss whether a new Congressional Budget Office analysis will help Democrats get enough House votes to pass the final package of legislation to overhaul health care.

headline.main: C.B.O: Health Bill Will Reduce Deficit
headline.sub: Congressional Budget Office Report Anticipates Savings

docs.snippet: The Times's Marcus Mabry and David M. Herszenhorn discuss whether a new Congressional Budget Office analysis will help Democrats get enough House votes to pass the final package of legislation to overhaul health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has called off his trip to Australia and Indonesia, deeming it necessary to stay in Washington to push for passage of the health care legislation up for a vote later this weekend in the House.

headline.main: Citing Health Care Vote, Obama Delays Asia Trip

docs.abstract: This is the second time that President Obama postponed his planned visit to Indonesia, both times over the health care battle being waged in Congress.
docs.snippet: This is the second time that President Obama postponed his planned visit to Indonesia, both times over the health care battle being waged in Congress.

docs.lead_paragraph: House Democratic leaders are holding a news conference now to trumpet the new cost analysis of their health care legislation.

headline.main: Democrats Prepare to Unveil the Final Bill

docs.abstract: The Democrats host a new conference to take the wraps off their comprehensive health care legislation.
docs.snippet: The Democrats host a new conference to take the wraps off their comprehensive health care legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Congressional Budget Office has released a preliminary analysis of the Democrats' final health care package (pdf) that puts the overall price tag of new insurance coverage provisions at $940 billion over 10 years, just below the $950 billion goal set by President Obama.

headline.main: Final Bill to Cost $940 Billion Over 10 Years

docs.abstract: A preliminary analysis by the Congressional Budget Office of the Democrats' final health care package puts the price tag of new insurance coverage provisions just below the goal pegged by President Obama.
docs.snippet: A preliminary analysis by the Congressional Budget Office of the Democrats' final health care package puts the price tag of new insurance coverage provisions just below the goal pegged by President Obama.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
docs.abstract: The latest on the health care overhaul, the risks associated with various ways to pay online and other consumer-focused items from Thursday's Times.
docs.snippet: The latest on the health care overhaul, the risks associated with various ways to pay online and other consumer-focused items from Thursday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Washington has spent many a morning during the year-long health care debate, awaiting the Congressional Budget Office score on one iteration of the bill or another.

headline.main: The Early Word: Health Care Score

docs.abstract: House Democrats may be able to set the weekend schedule for votes after receiving a score on the health care bill.
docs.snippet: House Democrats may be able to set the weekend schedule for votes after receiving a score on the health care bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. C. L. Otter became the first state chief executive to sign a measure requiring his attorney general to sue Congress if it passes health care legislation that requires residents to buy insurance.

headline.main: Idaho: Governor Signs Bill to Prevent Insurance Mandate
headline.print_headline: Idaho: Governor Signs Bill to Prevent Insurance Mandate

docs.snippet: Gov. C. L. Otter became the first state chief executive to sign a measure requiring his attorney general to sue Congress if it passes health care legislation that requires residents to buy insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Mark Steven Kirk said that if he won the president’s old Senate seat, he would work to repeal any health care legislation.

headline.main: Running for Obama’s Old Seat, and Set on Derailing His Plans
headline.print_headline: Running for Obama’s Old Seat, and Set on Derailing His Plans

docs.snippet: Representative Mark Steven Kirk said that if he won the president’s old Senate seat, he would work to repeal any health care legislation.
